alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 12:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL BROWN AND NORTHWESTERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 100 PM EDT... At 1224 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Georgetown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Winchester, Seaman, Russellville, Hamersville, Cherry Fork, Feesburg, Dunkinsville, Lake Waynoka, May Hill and State Route 32 at US Route 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
